tool.name: MEDUSA

param.name: Output_folder
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and folder name where the output from this tool will be stored. Please ensure that the path and folder name has NO SPACES.

param.name: Rainfall_events
param.dialogReference:
Specify the .DBF table containing the event information. The table must have the following columns (capitalisation and spelling sensitive):

  • Event: event number

  • Rain_pH: pH of event

  • DryDays: number of antecedent dry days (days)

  • Rain_mmhr: average rainfall intensity (mm/hr)

  • Dur_hr: event duration (hours)

param.name: Roof_shp
param.dialogReference:
Specify the shapefile containing the roof polygons. This shapefile must have the field RoofCode (integer type) with integers that correspond to the following roof types:

  • 1: Galvanised uncoated new

  • 2: Galvanised uncoated old

  • 3: Colorsteel New

  • 4: Colorsteel Old

  • 5: Galvanised painted, older

  • 6: Galvanised painted, newer

  • 7: Concrete, no Zn

  • 8: Concrete, Zn guttering

  • 9: Non-metallic

  • 10: Copper

param.name: Road_shp
param.dialogReference:
Specify the shapefile containing the road polygons. This shapefile must have the field RoadCode (integer type) with integers that correspond to the following road types:

  • 1: Major Arterial

  • 2: Minor Arterial

  • 3: Collector

  • 4: Local Road

  • 5: Private

param.name: Carpark_shp
param.dialogReference:
Specify the shapefile containing the carpark polygons. This shapefile must have the field CarCode (integer type) with integers that correspond to the following carpark types:

  • 1: Commercial

  • 2: Industrial Std

  • 3: Industrial Mnv

tool.summary:
WARNING:The coefficients for MEDUSA have been calibrated to Christchurch only. Please do not apply this tool outside of Christchurch.

This tool applies the Modelled Estimates of Discharges for Urban Stormwater Assessments (MEDUSA) model using the equations and coefficients formulated by Charters et al. [1]. For roofs, roads, and carparks, this tool calculates the Total Suspended Solids (TSS), Zinc, and Copper load from individual events. The output is saved as a series of CSV files showing the loads for all the events and the summary of loads (minimum, mean, and maximum).

[1] Charters, F. J., Cochrane, T. A., & O’Sullivan, A. D. (2020). Predicting event-based sediment and heavy metal loads in untreated urban runoff from impermeable surfaces. Water, 12(4), 969.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
WARNING:The coefficients for MEDUSA have been calibrated to Christchurch only. Please do not apply this tool outside of Christchurch.

This tool applies the Modelled Estimates of Discharges for Urban Stormwater Assessments (MEDUSA) model using the equations and coefficients formulated by Charters et al. [1]. For roofs, roads, and carparks, this tool calculates the Total Suspended Solids (TSS), Zinc, and Copper load from individual events. The output is saved as a series of CSV files showing the loads for all the events and the summary of loads (minimum, mean, and maximum).

[1] Charters, F. J., Cochrane, T. A., & O’Sullivan, A. D. (2020). Predicting event-based sediment and heavy metal loads in untreated urban runoff from impermeable surfaces. Water, 12(4), 969.
